column5: Dec 8 U.S. energy companies this week added oil rigs for a third week in a row  the longest string of increases since summer  as higher crude prices prompt drillers to return to the well pad after a break in the autumn. column4: Tyson Foods raises stake in plant-based protein maker Beyond Meat
column5: Tyson Foods   the largest U.S. meat processor  said on Thursday it slightly raised its stake in plant-based protein maker Beyond Meat as it looks to tap growing demand for alternative sources of protein.

column4: Oracle's Safra Catz among two new members named to Disney board
column5: Media company Walt Disney Co  on Thursday named Oracle Corp's  chief executive  Safra Catz  and her counterpart at Illumina Inc   Francis A. deSouza  to its board.

column4: Trump says fines against Wells Fargo could be increased
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK President Donald Trump took aim at the third-largest U.S. bank on Friday  writing on Twitter that government fines and penalties against Wells Fargo & Co could be hiked amid an ongoing sales scandal. | Video

column4: UPDATE 2-Trump says fines against Wells Fargo could be increased
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK  Dec 8 President Donald Trump took aim at the third-largest U.S. bank on Friday  writing on Twitter that government fines and penalties against Wells Fargo & Co could be hiked amid an ongoing sales scandal.

column4: Exclusive: Wells Fargo sanctions are on ice under Trump official - sources
column5: WASHINGTON The new acting head of the U.S. consumer finance watchdog is reviewing whether Wells Fargo & Co  should pay tens of millions of dollars over alleged mortgage lending abuse  according to three sources familiar with the dispute. | Video
